org.eMayor.ServiceHandling.PrintingUtility.ejb
Class HTMLPrinter

java.lang.Object
  org.eMayor.ServiceHandling.PrintingUtility.ejb.HTMLPrinter

public class HTMLPrinter
extends java.lang.Object

Prints text, HTML and RTF documents by rendered in a JEditorPane by the appropriate EditorKit.

Author:
imavr

Constructor Detail

HTMLPrinter

public HTMLPrinter(javax.swing.JEditorPane Jep,
                   javax.print.attribute.PrintRequestAttributeSet pras,
                   javax.print.PrintService defaultPrintService,
                   javax.print.PrintService[] availableServices,
                   int unit,
                   boolean pages)
Creates a new instance of HTMLPrinter

Parameters:
Jep - The JEditorPane in which the content has been rendered
pras - The PrintRequestAttributeSet that defines the printing parameters
defaultPrintService - The system's default Print Service
availableServices - The system's available Print Services
unit - javax.print.attribute.standard.MediaSize.MM or javax.print.attribute.standard.MediaSize.INCH used in internal calculations
pages - true or false for paging function. If no paging is selected the document will be scaled to fit in one page.
Method Detail

public void setPreview(boolean prv)

Parameters:
x - The print dialog's top left point position along the screen's horizontal axis
y - The print dialog's top left point position along the screen's vertical axis

preview

public void preview(int w,
                    int h)
             throws javax.print.PrintException
Instantiates a PrintPreviewDialog to preview the JEditorPane's rendering before printing (the printing may be cancelled by the user though the PrintPreviewDialog)

Parameters:
w - The width of the PrintPreviewDialog. Determined by the JEditorPane's size and reflects the printing parameters
h - The height of the PrintPreviewDialog. Determined by the JEditorPane's size and reflects the printing parameters
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

getPrintPreviewDialog

public PrintPreviewDialog getPrintPreviewDialog()
Gets the PringPreviewDialog object

Returns:
this PrintPreviewDialog object

printJEditorPane

public boolean printJEditorPane(javax.print.PrintService ps)
                         throws javax.print.PrintException
Prints the contents of the JEditorPane using the specified Print Service
Calculates the number of pages (if paging is enabled) according to the printing parameters (size, orientation, etc).
The contents of the JEditorPane are bufferred as a PNG image which is used to create the print document (SimpleDoc).
If paging is enabled the PNG image is split to the nubmer of pages required to fit the image (according to the size and orientation specified in the printing parameters)

Parameters:
ps - The Print Service to be used for printing the contents of the JEditorPane
Returns:
true if printing is successful or false if printing is not successful
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

bufferedImagetoByteArray

public byte[] bufferedImagetoByteArray(java.awt.image.BufferedImage o)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Converts a java.awt.image.BufferedImage to a byte array
The method is declared as synchronized to allow for the full image to be converted before proceeding to the printing operation

Parameters:
o - The java.awt.image.BufferedImage to be converted to byte array
Returns:
The byte array containing the BufferedImage's content.
If the BufferedImage is null the byte array will be empty (zero-length)
Throws:
java.io.IOException

printDocument

public boolean printDocument(javax.print.Doc doc,
                             javax.print.PrintService ps)
                      throws javax.print.PrintException
Prints the document to the specified Print Service
This method cannot tell if the printing was successful. You must register a PrintJobListener
Registers the added PrintAttributeListeners to the specified Print Service
Registers the added PrintServiceJobListeners to the created DocPrintJob

Parameters:
doc - The javax.print.Doc to be printed
ps - The javax.print.PrintService to be used for printing
Returns:
true if a PrintService is selected and no Exception is thrown during printing
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

showPrintDialog

public javax.print.PrintService showPrintDialog(javax.print.attribute.PrintRequestAttributeSet atset)
Shows a Print Dialog initiatied by the specified printing parameters (PrintRequestAttributeSet) allowing the user to alter them or cancel the printing.
If more than one Print Service are available to be selected, the default Print Service is initially selected.

Parameters:
atset - The javax.print.attribute.PrintRequestAttributeSet containing the applying printing parameters.
These are reflected in the Print Dialog allowing the user to review or alter them.
Returns:
The Print Service selected by the Print Dialog

printEditorPane

public void printEditorPane(boolean showPrintDialog)
                     throws javax.print.PrintException
Prints the contents of the JEditorPane either to the Print Service selected by a Print Dialog or to the default Print Service

Parameters:
showPrintDialog - true for showing the Print Dialog, false for printing to the default Print Service (without altering the PrintRequestAttributeSet)
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException
